Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Hometown''' is an [[unincorporated area|unincorporated]] [[census-designated place]] located along the [[Kanawha River]] on [[West Virginia Route 62]] in [[Putnam County, West Virginia|Putnam County]], [[West Virginia]], [[United States]]. As of the [[United States Census, 2010|2010 census]], its population was 668.{{GR|8}} Hometown has 7 streets that are intersected by 1 street. There is an elementary school. The red house on the left in the photo was built by Thomas M. Brown and Ella Mae Criner Brown in the early 1920s, and was the first house built at Hometown. ==Gallery== <gallery> Image:HometownWV.jpg|Hometown, WV Image:HometownWVPark.jpg|Hometown's community park has been mostly abandoned in recent years. </gallery> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Putnam County, West Virginia}} [[Category:Populated places in Putnam County, West Virginia]] [[Category:Census-designated places in West Virginia]] [[Category:Charleston, West Virginia metropolitan area]] [[Category:Populated places on the Kanawha River]] {{PutnamWV-geo-stub}}
